intro: Sericocoma capensis, commonly known as the Cape sericocoma, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy soils and salt spray. Its yellow flowers are arranged in dense clusters, and it produces small, dry fruits called cypsela. Sericocoma capensis is often found in coastal dunes and is an important part of the local flora.
